    "content_preview": "# Marketing & Communications

## Overview

The Marketing & Communications team builds Hypernet's brand, drives user acquisition, and establishes market leadership in personal AI infrastructure. This team executes the go-to-market strategy through content marketing, community building, social media, PR, events, and paid acquisition. Marketing works closely with Sales, Product, and Partnerships to drive growth from 0 to 100,000+ users while positioning Hypernet as the trusted platform for data sovereignty and privacy-first AI.

## Role and Responsibilities

### Brand Strategy and Positioning
- Define and communicate Hypernet's brand identity and value proposition
- Position Hypernet as the category leader in personal data infrastructure
- Develop messaging and positioning for different audiences (consumers, developers, enterprises)
- Create and maintain brand guidelines (visual identity, voice, tone)
- Build thought leadership around data sovereignty, privacy, and AI ethics

### Content Marketing and SEO
- Publish high-quality blog content (2-5 posts per week depending on phase)
- Create educational content (guides, tutorials, whitepapers, case studies)
- Develop SEO strategy to drive organic traffic (target: 5K → 100K monthly visitors)
- Write technical documentation for developers and integration guides
- Produce video content (product demos, tutorials, thought leadership)
- Build email marketing campaigns for nurture, onboarding, and retention

### Social Media and Community
- Manage company social media presence (Twitter/X, LinkedIn, Reddit, etc.)
- Build and engage developer community (Discord, forums, Stack Overflow)
- Create and share user-generated content and testimonials
- Run social media campaigns aligned with product launches and partnerships
- Monitor social listening and engage with mentions and feedback

### Public Relations and Media
- Secure media coverage in tier 1 and tier 2 tech publications
- Write and distribute press releases for funding, partnerships, product launches
- Build relationships with journalists, analysts, and influencers
- Coordinate media briefings and interviews
- Manage crisis communications if needed
- Track media mentions and brand sentiment

### Developer Relations and Advocacy
- Create developer-focused content (API docs, tutorials, SDKs, sample apps)
- Organize hackathons, demo days, and developer events
- Build relationships with influential developers and AI enthusiasts
- Showcase apps built on Hypernet platform
- Provide technical content for developer channels (YouTube, Dev.to, Medium)
- Measure developer satisfaction and API adoption

### Events and Sponsorships
- Attend and sponsor industry conferences (AI, privacy, developer conferences)
- Host webinars and virtual events
- Organize community meetups and user groups
- Coordinate ProductHunt launches and HackerNews engagement
- Plan and execute company events (launch parties, milestone celebrations)

### Paid Acquisition and Growth Marketing
- Run paid advertising campaigns (Google Ads, Twitter, Reddit, LinkedIn)
- Optimize conversion funnels and landing pages
- Implement A/B testing for messaging, creative, and CTAs
- Manage CAC targets across channels (target blended CAC <$200)
- Build referral programs and viral loops
- Track attribution and ROI by channel

### Product Marketing
- Lead go-to-market for new features and product launches
- Create product positioning and messaging
- Develop sales enablement materials (pitch decks, one-pagers, case studies)
- Conduct competitive analysis and market research
- Define pricing and packaging strategies
- Support partnerships with co-marketing campaigns

### Analytics and Reporting
- Track marketing KPIs (traffic, leads, signups, conversions, CAC, LTV)
- Build attribution models to understand channel effectiveness
- Report on marketing ROI and performance to leadership
- Conduct user research and analyze customer feedback
- Create dashboards for real-time marketing metrics

## Planned Positions and Roles

### Phase 1: Private Beta (Mar-May 2026, Team: 1-2)

**Founder/CEO** (Current)
- Acts as interim marketing lead
- Write early blog posts and social media content
- Manage PR for initial launch
- Personal brand building (Twitter/X, LinkedIn)
- Reports to: Board

**Growth Lead (Contract)** (Month 1-3)
- Content marketing and SEO
- Social media management
- Community building (Discord setup)
- ProductHunt launch coordination
- Reports to: CEO

**External Partners:**
- PR agency (optional for seed announcement)
- Design contractor (landing page, brand identity)
- Content writers (contract)

### Phase 2: Public Beta (Jun-Dec 2026, Team: 5-10)

**Head of Marketing** (Hired Month 4-5)
- Overall marketing strategy and execution
- Build and lead marketing team
- Own user acquisition and brand goals
- Manage marketing budget ($60K/month → scaling)
- Reports to: CEO

**Content Marketing Manager** (Month 6-8)
- Blog and SEO strategy
- Content calendar and publishing
- Developer documentation and tutorials
- Email marketing campaigns
- Reports to: Head of Marketing

**Social Media and Community Manager** (Month 6-8)
- Manage all social media channels
- Build and engage community (Discord, forums)
- Create social content and campaigns
- Monitor brand sentiment
- Reports to: Head of Marketing

**Product Marketing Manager** (Month 8-10)
- Product launches and GTM
- Competitive positioning
- Sales enablement materials
- Partnership co-marketing
- Reports to: Head of Marketing

**Growth Marketing Manager** (Month 9-12)
- Paid acquisition strategy
- Conversion optimization
- Referral and viral programs
- Analytics and attribution
- Reports to: Head of Marketing

**Designer (Marketing)** (Month 8-12)
- Brand and marketing design
- Landing pages and web assets
- Social media graphics
- Presentation decks
- Reports to: Head of Marketing

**Developer Advocate** (Month 10-12)
- Developer community engagement
- Technical content creation
- Hackathons and developer events
- API feedback to product team
- Reports to: Head of Marketing or CTO

### Phase 3: Growth (2027, Team: 15-25)

**VP of Marketing / CMO** (Q2-Q3 2027)
- Elevate Head of Marketing or hire external CMO
- Strategic marketing leadership
- Build marketing team to 15-25 people
- Align marketing with $5M MRR revenue goal
- Reports to: CEO

**Content Team (3-5)** (Q1-Q4 2027)
- **Content Marketing Lead** (Q1): Strategy, team management
- **SEO Specialist** (Q2): SEO optimization, keyword research, technical SEO
- **Content Writers (2-3)** (Q1-Q3): Blog, guides, case studies, emails
- **Video Producer** (Q3-Q4): Video content creation, editing, production
- Reports to: Content Marketing Lead or VP Marketing

**Brand and Creative Team (3-5)** (Q1-Q4 2027)
- **Brand Manager** (Q2): Brand strategy, guidelines, campaigns
- **Senior Designer** (Q1): Lead design projects, mentor team
- **Designers (2-3)** (Q2-Q4): Marketing design, web, social
- Reports to: Brand Manager or VP Marketing

**Growth and Performance Marketing (3-5)** (Q1-Q4 2027)
- **Growth Marketing Lead** (Q1): Growth strategy, team management
- **Paid Acquisition Specialist** (Q2): Manage ad campaigns (Google, social)
- **Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO) Specialist** (Q3): Landing pages, A/B testing
- **Marketing Analyst** (Q3): Analytics, attribution, reporting
- Reports to: Growth Marketing Lead or VP Marketing

**Product Marketing (2-3)** (Q1-Q3 2027)
- **Senior Product Marketing Manager** (Q1): Lead PMM function
- **Product Marketing Managers (1-2)** (Q2-Q3): Feature launches, sales enablement
- Reports to: VP Marketing or VP Product

**PR and Communications (1-2)** (Q2-Q4 2027)
- **PR Manager** (Q2): Media relations, press releases, analyst relations
- **Communications Specialist** (Q4): Internal comms, executive comms
- Reports to: VP Marketing or CEO

**Community and Developer Relations (2-3)** (Q1-Q4 2027)
- **Community Manager** (Q1): Discord, forums, user engagement
- **Developer Advocates (1-2)** (Q2-Q4): Technical content, hackathons, developer events
- Reports to: VP Marketing or CTO

**Events and Partnerships Marketing (1-2)** (Q3-Q4 2027)
- **Events Manager** (Q3): Conferences, webinars, company events
- **Partnership Marketing Manager** (Q4): Co-marketing with partners
- Reports to: VP Marketing

### Phase 4: Market Leadership (2028, Team: 25-40)

**Chief Marketing Officer (CMO)** (H1 2028)
- C-suite marketing leadership
- Global brand strategy
- Team of 25-40+ people
- International marketing expansion
- Reports to: CEO

**Marketing Teams:**
- **Content and SEO:** 5-8 people
- **Brand and Creative:** 5-8 people
- **Growth and Performance:** 6-10 people
- **Product Marketing:** 4-6 people
- **PR and Communications:** 3-5 people
- **Community and DevRel:** 4-6 people
- **Events and Field Marketing:** 3-5 people

## Hiring Timeline and Fundraising Phases

### Phase 1: Seed (Mar-May 2026)
- **Funding:** Self-funded
- **Hires:** Growth Lead (contract)
- **Total Marketing Team:** 1-2 people (CEO + contract)
- **Budget:** $20K-30K total for 3 months
- **Focus:** Private beta launch, first 1,000 users, content foundation

### Phase 2: Series Seed (Jun-Dec 2026)
- **Funding:** $20M Series Seed
- **Hires:** Head of Marketing, Content Manager, Social/Community Manager, PMM, Growth Manager, Designer
- **Total Marketing Team:** 5-10 people
- **Budget:** $300K-500K for 6 months (includes team + paid acquisition)
- **Focus:** Public
